centrifugal_nozzle_{NOZZLE}_overheated.name: Centrifugal Nozzle {SAME[NOZZLE]} Overheated
solutions: Verify that the centrifugal nozzle motor feels hot. If so, let the motor cool down for 10 minutes before resuming operations.
If overheating persists and affects only one of the two nozzle motors, try swap tests.

centrifugal_nozzle_{NOZZLE}_stuck.name: Centrifugal Nozzle {SAME[NOZZLE]} Stuck
solutions: Check if the centrifugal nozzle motor is stuck.

check_valve_{PUMP}_stuck.name: M{ARM[PUMP]} Arm Check Valve is Stuck
solutions: Disassemble the check valve, clean its componentes, and reassemble it.

pump_{PUMP}_impeller_stuck.name: Pump {SAME[PUMP]} Impeller is Stuck
solutions: Open the pump casing and clean the impeller.

pump_{PUMP}_overheated.name: Pump {SAME[PUMP]} Overheated
solutions: Verify that the pump motor feels hot. If so, let the motor cool down for 10 minutes before resuming operations.
If overheating persists and affects only one of the two pump motors, try swap tests.

liquid_level_gauge_misalignment.name: Liquid Level Gauge Out Misalignment
solutions: Check if the liquid level gauge is misaligned or misplaced.

thick_mixture.name: Pesticide Mixture is Too Thick
solutions: Try a lighter mixture and avoid using wettable powders (WP) or thick suspension concentrates (SC) whenever possible.

solutions.suggestion: Avoid the following products in powder or suspension concentrate presentations. If needed, prefer soluble liquid (SL) or pre-diluted formulations.

products.name: 2,4-D (amine salts safer; poor-quality or WP versions problematic)
Micronutrient powders (zinc oxide, manganese oxide, borax, etc.)

solutions: Apply the secondary dilution method, also known as the two-step dilution method. That is, pre-dilute each product alone (by itself) in a small to medium-sized container before adding it to the main mixture tank.
